alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 11:14AM CDT until April 15 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. .River rises from melting snow will result in minor flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.1 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Cottonwood Street west of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT Sunday, the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 12.5 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 06/24/2011. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
